With Code Type Functions

Source: R/with_code_type_helpers.R
with_code_type_helpers.Rd

These functions allow users to specify a code type and execute CodeMiner code within that context.

Usage

icd10(code)

icd9(code)

read3(code)

read2(code)

sct(code)

opcs4(code)

phecode(code)

read2_drugs(code)

bnf(code)

dmd(code)

data_coding_3(code)

data_coding_4(code)

data_coding_5(code)

data_coding_6(code)

medcode_aurum(code)

prodcode_aurum(code)

Arguments

code

The code to be processed.

Value

The result of executing the code within the specified code_type context.

Details

Available functions:

  • icd10()

  • icd9()

  • read3()

  • read2()

  • sct()

  • opcs4()

  • phecode()

  • read2_drugs()

  • bnf()

  • dmd()

  • data_coding_3()

  • data_coding_4()

  • data_coding_5()

  • data_coding_6()

  • medcode_aurum()

  • prodcode_aurum()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
icd10(DESCRIPTION("diabetes"))
bnf(CODES("0204 << Beta-Adrenoceptor Blocking Drugs >>"))
sct(
  CHILDREN(
    "770765001 << Proliferative retinopathy of right eye due to diabetes mellitus (disorder) >>"
  )
)
} # }
